headline: Getting to know the Basque Country
text: In this timeline we guide you through some main events in the history of the Basque Country. As our main topic is "Getting to know the Basque Country" we want to show these main events in a chronological way so you will learn more about the region you are currently studying in.

headline: Fernando The Catholic
text: Fernando The Catholic conquered upper Navarre

headline: The Thirty Years' War
text: The Basque Country experiences the repercussions of the Thirty Years' War and the Franco-Spanish War, resulting in armed conflicts, economic difficulties, and changes in political alliances.

headline: First Carlist War
text: centered on the homelands of the Basque Country and Aragon. Catalonia and Valencia

headline: Ikurriña — Creation of the basque flag
text: Created by Sabino Arana Gori, considered the founder of modern Basque nationalism. First in Biscay, in 1933 for the whole Basque Country

headline: Spanish Civil War
text: The Basque country fouht on the Republican side under their own government and president.

headline: Euskadi ta Askatasuna
text: ETA (Euskadi ta Askatasuna which is Basque Homeland and Freedom) is formed to fight for Basque self-determination. On the 5th of September 2010 there was a truce between ETA and the Basque Country . On the 8th of April 2017 the ETA was disarmed and on the 2th of May 2018 ETA was ended

headline: Spreading of the Basque language
text: Basque and Castilian on equal footing, ETB (Basque Television) created in 1984

headline: Legalisation of the basque flag
text: Requested on the 16th by mayor cities and approved and raised in Pamplona for the first time

headline: Creation of the Basque government
text: Since 1981, and after the negotiations among the central Government, the Deputations and the Basque Government, the old foral structure of the Deputations began to be reimplemented.
